abstract: Fiat Chrysler faces public backlash after it refuses to repair some of 1.6 million recalled Jeep models because they are too rusty; refusal has also raised questions among regulators, including National Highway Traffic Safety Admin, which is preparing to examine company's overall recall practices at July hearing.
lead_paragraph: The carmaker’s unwillingness to fix some rusty Jeeps comes as the highway safety agency is preparing for a hearing on the automaker’s recall practices in general.

headline.main: Fiat Chrysler Raises Hackles by Refusing to Fix Some Recalled Jeeps
headline.print_headline: Fiat Chrysler Raises Hackles by Refusing to Fix Some Recalled Jeeps

snippet: The carmaker’s unwillingness to fix some rusty Jeeps comes as the highway safety agency is preparing for a hearing on the automaker’s recall practices in general.
